pros: Reduced meals in cafeteria, casual work environment, great team and management.

pros: Attentive and caring management team

pros: Flexibility, great management, and great patients!

review_title: Beware Radiology Techs and Staff of Fairbanks Memorial Hospital aka Foundation Health Partners
pros: One of the largest employers in Fairbanks, AK.
cons: Leadership is the biggest problem currently. Every company is having staffing issues but we would not be in the deficient we are seeing if we had engaged leadership who listens to staff. The techs are miserable and often have no one to turn to. The communication is reposted what is on our intranet verbatim. If you have an issue afterhours the instructions is NOT to call your supervisor. Longterm employees are leaving. Travelers will not stay on. Favoritism abounds and complaints are go unheard.

pros: Benefits and pay are decent for area. Pretty high turnover though.
cons: TVC BO can be gossipy if you're on the wrong side of things. Supervisors are often unhelpful and sometimes left to just figure things out.

pros: Always hiring, good on the job training, great facilities
cons: Horrible with home-work life balance NO holiday pay. None. It comes directly from your PTO which is BASICALLY non existent. PETTYYYYYY management

review_title: A postive company to work for

cons: They ask for a lot of overtime hours. They don't expect it but they do ask frequently.

pros: The hours are pretty flexible
cons: The health insurance is really expensive

review_title: The atmosphere and culture of FHP is like no other place I've been.
job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Fairbanks, AK
pros: The environment at FHP is simply amazing. Within our department, everyone is family. We stick together and have each other's back. Outside of the department, this friendly atmosphere continues. No matter where I go within this building, I'm greeted with friendly smiles and caring attitudes whether it is in the cafe, hallways, or by management. There are a ton of opportunities for personal development and continuing education. If I have any issues, I know I can go to my direct supervisor or director. This hospital administration goes out of their way to make the employee feel welcome and appreciated.  I enjoy knowing that I work for an organization that cares for it's employees as much as it cares for it's patients.
cons: The cafe closes at midnight, and re-opens at 0600, which can make it difficult for those working night shift if you are busy. Also, this hospital does not have a tier system for RNs  with incentives to raise from RN I to RN II or so on with additional education, certifications, or the like.

review_title: For over 8 years I have worked among family
pros:
I have worked for FMH for almost 9 years and I am still happy here.  Not only does the hospital own itself so it gets to make all its own decisions, but the team that runs our hospital try so hard to include our voices in it's decisions as well.  They offer fun things for their staff like a food truck rally 
(with coupons to free food from the community food trucks brought to our hospital.) an outdoor BBQ (celebrating employees with employments longer than 3,5,10 etc years), or the family fun day that includes feeding all the families that come from the hospital. 

FMH is also fair about how mistakes are made and how we can work through them instead of faulting people for them.  I have great benefits and the foundation tries really hard to keep us happy.  This place is a home for me and the teamwork I have seen here is better than any job I have had.
cons: Sometimes the wait times in the ER are pretty long and the patients all have something to say about it.

review_title: Truly the most welcoming, caring & honest hospital I have worked for.
job_title: Respiratory Care Practitioner in Fairbanks, AK
pros:
Being a military family we move around a lot, which means.. I bounce around to different hospitals every couple of years. In the last 6 years, I have worked at 5 different facilities and I can honestly say that FMH is the most welcoming, caring and honest hospital that I have ever worked for. Not only does HR make the new hire phase so convenient & smooth but every person I encountered since the day I walked through FMH doors 6 months ago has greeted me with open arms & a smile! ..And let me just say that my supervisor is absolutely amazing! I have never had a boss be more involved with her staff to ensure we are all satisfied -to the best of her abilities - with our work environment. 
I can honestly say that I came to Fairbanks dreading being here for 3 years.. but, because I love my job here at FMH.. I think when that 3 years is up, I will dread leaving Fairbanks because of how wonderful my boss, coworkers & truly.. everyone is here at FMH!!
cons: Nothing negative to say,  truly!!

review_title: I have been a long time employee of Fairbanks Memorial Hospital (27 years) and I love working here!
pros: Foundation Health truly adopts the philosophy of "patients first" as well as working hard to maintain healthy work-life balances. We are a non-profit, as well as being owned by the community.  Our goals are truly focused on what is best and what is needed in the community, whether it makes money or not! We are truly focused on providing the highest quality of diagnostics, treatments and patient care possible. I am speaking as if FHP is my home and pride and joy. Well, it is! This is my home and my family, and we serve my community. I take a lot of pride in this.
cons: There is a fair amount of turn-over, due to the two military bases here. However, as we work with these military families, they bring new ideas to FHP.

pros:
I get to work in a variety of athletic training settings, including high school and semi-professional sports as well as clinical. Its a very well rounded position so you don't get burned out on one thing too quickly. 

Foundation Health offers great incentives to get employees to Fairbanks. I was already sold on the job, and the incentives were just a plus! 

They really know how to take care of employees and value them as individuals. My grandmother passed away approx. 2 months after I started here, resulting in me having to leave for the lower 48 for over a week. Vacation was donated to me by my peers and I am so grateful. I love working here.
cons: The only con about this job is that I am far away from my family, but they know I am the adventurous one and we find many ways to stay in touch!

review_title: Best place to work in Fairbanks
pros: TVC First care has been an incredible working environment. As a nurse, it can be hard to find employment where a staff member really feels part of a team. First Care excels at teamwork. Providers are very willing to teach staff, managers and leadership work hard to make staff feel appreciated, and patient care is outstanding.
cons: We enjoy our jobs and we laugh all day. Sometimes, this can make our faces hurt from smiling. :-)

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Fairbanks, AK
pros: Pay is relatively good, but because of cost of living in this area, still not quite enough.
cons: As a new therapist, opportunities to get really good at certain aspects of the job was a challenge; we did not have a high enough volume for an inexperienced therapist to be able to gain experience.  We were not in a position for me to have a clinical instructor unfortunately.   My "homegrown" experience left parts of my training lacking.  We are not a respiratory school.  Working here would be best suited for someone trained elsewhere, many of my coworkers do really well here, even new grads as long as they got their education elsewhere.  Good for travelers who wa t the Alaska experience.

pros: Co-workers become family. While you may have family away from you and located across the United States, like myself, your coworkers become your support and family, always looking out for you and being there for you when you need it. Support and encouragement is given daily, making you the best you can be, empowering you to strive for your best, and if you back step, they keep pushing you to keep going without judgement. For me, they have filled a void where my family has left off due to their location, my coworkers make me feel complete and accepted. I am truly grateful to have this opportunity.
cons: I have not found anything wrong. I am very happy to be working here.

pros: I have worked at Foundation Health for 4 years. This is by far the best hospital I have ever worked for! Nurse to patient ratios are excellent, and management cares more about safe staffing than budget. The hospital is community owned, it does so much to support the community and always put patients first! For being a small community the hospital they do a great job keeping up with current technology, offering continued education and career advancement. The culture  in this hospital is unmatched. I truly feel that my coworkers and my management team care about me and the patients they serve.
cons: Any issues I have ever encountered have been handled in a professional manner by my management team.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Fairbanks, AK
pros: I just started working at FMH last week but I can already tell this is going to be a great job! I am a full-time student so it was important for me to find a job that could work with my schedule. My is amazing about asking me when my classes are and getting input from me on my schedule preference. My colleagues are also great! I ask them a ton of questions and they never get frustrated or annoyed with me. Overall, it's a great place to work and I feel very valued as a CNA!
cons: The orientation can be long but it is beneficial and educating.

review_title: I LOVE working for the hospital. I did not work there when it was ran by Banner but it's been great!
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Fairbanks, AK
pros: My boss, my coworkers & I feel like I'm making a difference.
cons: I honestly haven't found a con yet but if I was to decide on one I suppose it's that I think with Fairbanks limited job market when they do find good employees they tend to over work them but it keeps people busy and pockets full!

review_title: Depending on boss, I've had a bad experience and a great one! Great job with current leadership.
pros: Fellow CT techs are wonderful. Current leadership is amazing and really listens. The manager even meets with each employee once a month to check on how things are going. Each employee is expected to learn all of the studies, no one person does any particular thing.
cons: Long winter. ED department does not play nicely with radiology. That's jotting new though. Benefits could be better, the dental is terrible. 401k is good.

pros: Leaving a state government position after ten years of service I have no regrets coming onboard to FMH.  There is a very clear Mission and Vision that the leadership promotes daily.  The HR team that helped with my package and relocation were friendly, prompt and professional.  The Administration holds themselves as well their leaders accountable to the Mission and Vision of FHP.   My first six months here have been an extremely positive experience.
cons: Typical office politics that you find in any organization.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Fairbanks, AK
pros: My family and I relocated here from the East Coast to start a new adventure with FHP;  they never left our side through the whole process and have made a huge difference in our transition.  So excited for my future at Fairbanks Memorial.
cons: Nothing negative to say- they have given me a new career and also a great town to call home!

pros: I love working at First Care- we work so well as a team. We have a variety of patients so it never gets boring. We have great fun and laugh a lot.
cons: The clinic is open later hours, as well as weekends. While that is good for patients, the schedule is less appealing to many and we have a more frequent turnover than many of the others provider's offices.

review_title: 1st Care TVC Best Place to Work
pros: Lots of diversity. Working in a team environment. Connecting with patients and their providers instantly. Working next with providers. Family and friendly atmosphere. Exposure to diversity of patients. We always get a lunch break.
cons: Work every other weekend. It's necessary as clinic is open daily 8am to 8pm.

pros: Fair pay, very inviting and inclusive. Willingness to do what it takes to ensure all employees feel that their job is secure.
cons: A lot of movement within the company.

pros: Great coworkers, management, and environment. Management is very patient centered and focused on staying up to date on latest evidence based care. Wide variety of patient acuity. Small, tight knit hospital and community.
cons: Small hospital, limited community resources.

job_title: Front Office Representative in Fairbanks, AK
pros: Decent pay for only requiring a high school diploma or GED for the position.
cons: High turn over rate. Poor communication between management and staff.

pros: Ability to move into education or leadership if interested, flexible benefits, diverse workforce and tons of employee appreciation!
cons: Mild politics just like anywhere else, totally navigable

pros: True just culture, supportive leadership, good PTO accrual, flexible scheduling
cons: Significant leadership turnover, significant number of travel nurses in the ER, leadership that contradict each other,
